author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 35
segments.en: Linked Discourses 35

segments.pli: 9. Channavagga
segments.en: 9. With Channa

segments.pli: 93. Dutiyadvayasutta
segments.en: 93. A Duality (2nd)

segments.pli: “Dvayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭicca viññāṇaṃ sambhoti.
segments.en: “Mendicants, consciousness exists dependent on a duality.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, dvayaṃ paṭicca viññāṇaṃ sambhoti?
segments.en: And what is that duality?

segments.pli: Cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇaṃ.
segments.en: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights.

segments.pli: Cakkhu aniccaṃ vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi.
segments.en: The eye is impermanent, perishing, and changing.

segments.pli: Rūpā aniccā vipariṇāmino aññathābhāvino.
segments.en: Sights are impermanent, perishing, and changing.

segments.pli: Itthetaṃ dvayaṃ calañceva byathañca aniccaṃ vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi.
segments.en: So this duality is tottering and toppling; it’s impermanent, perishing, and changing.

segments.pli: Cakkhuviññāṇaṃ aniccaṃ vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi.
segments.en: Eye consciousness is impermanent, perishing, and changing.

segments.pli: Yopi hetu yopi paccayo cakkhuviññāṇassa uppādāya, sopi hetu sopi paccayo anicco vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī.
segments.en: And the causes and conditions that give rise to eye consciousness are also impermanent, perishing, and changing.

segments.pli: Aniccaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, paccayaṃ paṭicca uppannaṃ cakkhuviññāṇaṃ kuto niccaṃ bhavissati.
segments.en: But since eye consciousness has arisen dependent on conditions that are impermanent, how could it be permanent?

segments.pli: Yā kho, bhikkhave, imesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ saṅgati sannipāto samavāyo, ayaṃ vuccati cakkhusamphasso.
segments.en: The meeting, coming together, and joining together of these three things is called eye contact.

segments.pli: Cakkhusamphassopi anicco vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī.
segments.en: Eye contact is also impermanent, perishing, and changing.

segments.pli: Yopi hetu yopi paccayo cakkhusamphassassa uppādāya, sopi hetu sopi paccayo anicco vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī.
segments.en: And the causes and conditions that give rise to eye contact are also impermanent, perishing, and changing.

segments.pli: Aniccaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, paccayaṃ paṭicca uppanno cakkhusamphasso kuto nicco bhavissati.
segments.en: But since eye contact has arisen dependent on conditions that are impermanent, how could it be permanent?

segments.pli: Phuṭṭho, bhikkhave, vedeti, phuṭṭho ceteti, phuṭṭho sañjānāti.
segments.en: Contacted, one feels, intends, and perceives.

segments.pli: Itthetepi dhammā calā ceva byathā ca aniccā vipariṇāmino aññathābhāvino … pe …
segments.en: So these things are tottering and toppling; they’re impermanent, perishing, and changing.

segments.pli: Jivhañca paṭicca rase ca uppajjati jivhāviññāṇaṃ.
segments.en: Ear consciousness … Nose consciousness … Tongue consciousness … Body consciousness …

segments.pli: Jivhā aniccā vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī.
Rasā aniccā vipariṇāmino aññathābhāvino.
Itthetaṃ dvayaṃ calañceva byathañca aniccaṃ vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi.
Jivhāviññāṇaṃ aniccaṃ vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi.
Yopi hetu yopi paccayo jivhāviññāṇassa uppādāya, sopi hetu sopi paccayo anicco vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī.
Aniccaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, paccayaṃ paṭicca uppannaṃ jivhāviññāṇaṃ, kuto niccaṃ bhavissati.
Yā kho, bhikkhave, imesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ saṅgati sannipāto samavāyo, ayaṃ vuccati jivhāsamphasso.
Jivhāsamphassopi anicco vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī.
Yopi hetu yopi paccayo jivhāsamphassassa uppādāya, sopi hetu sopi paccayo anicco vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī.
Aniccaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, paccayaṃ paṭicca uppanno jivhāsamphasso, kuto nicco bhavissati.
Phuṭṭho, bhikkhave, vedeti, phuṭṭho ceteti, phuṭṭho sañjānāti.
Itthetepi dhammā calā ceva byathā ca aniccā vipariṇāmino aññathābhāvino … pe …
Manañca paṭicca dhamme ca uppajjati manoviññāṇaṃ.
segments.en: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and thoughts.

segments.pli: Mano anicco vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī.
segments.en: The mind is impermanent, perishing, and changing.

segments.pli: Dhammā aniccā vipariṇāmino aññathābhāvino.
segments.en: Thoughts are impermanent, perishing, and changing.

segments.pli: Itthetaṃ dvayaṃ calañceva byathañca aniccaṃ vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi.
segments.en: So this duality is tottering and toppling; it’s impermanent, perishing, and changing.

segments.pli: Manoviññāṇaṃ aniccaṃ vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi.
segments.en: Mind consciousness is impermanent, perishing, and changing.

segments.pli: Yopi hetu yopi paccayo manoviññāṇassa uppādāya, sopi hetu sopi paccayo anicco vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī.
segments.en: And the causes and conditions that give rise to mind consciousness are also impermanent, perishing, and changing.

segments.pli: Aniccaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, paccayaṃ paṭicca uppannaṃ manoviññāṇaṃ, kuto niccaṃ bhavissati.
segments.en: But since mind consciousness has arisen dependent on conditions that are impermanent, how could it be permanent?

segments.pli: Yā kho, bhikkhave, imesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ saṅgati sannipāto samavāyo, ayaṃ vuccati manosamphasso.
segments.en: The meeting, coming together, and joining together of these three things is called mind contact.

segments.pli: Manosamphassopi anicco vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī.
segments.en: Mind contact is also impermanent, perishing, and changing.

segments.pli: Yopi hetu yopi paccayo manosamphassassa uppādāya, sopi hetu sopi paccayo anicco vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī.
segments.en: And the causes and conditions that give rise to mind contact are also impermanent, perishing, and changing.

segments.pli: Aniccaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, paccayaṃ paṭicca uppanno manosamphasso, kuto nicco bhavissati.
segments.en: But since mind contact has arisen dependent on conditions that are impermanent, how could it be permanent?

segments.pli: Phuṭṭho, bhikkhave, vedeti, phuṭṭho ceteti, phuṭṭho sañjānāti.
segments.en: Contacted, one feels, intends, and perceives.

segments.pli: Itthetepi dhammā calā ceva byathā ca aniccā vipariṇāmino aññathābhāvino.
segments.en: So these things are tottering and toppling; they’re impermanent, perishing, and changing.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dvayaṃ paṭicca viññāṇaṃ sambhotī”ti.
segments.en: This is how consciousness exists dependent on a duality.”

segments.pli: Dasamaṃ.
Channavaggo catuttho.
Palokasuññā saṅkhittaṃ,
channo puṇṇo ca bāhiyo;
Ejena ca duve vuttā,
dvayehi apare duveti.

sections.title: “Mendicants, consciousness exists dependent on a duality.

suttaplex.blurb: Consciousness arises from the dyad of the interior sense organ with its corresponding exterior sense stimulus. All these things are conditioned, impermanent, and constantly falling apart.
